title: Understanding the Four Categories of Magnetism.
first_phrase: In the preceding text, the author introduced the concept of magnetism and its three major categories: Scientific Global Magnetism, Human Magnetism, and Mental Magnetism. In this final part, the author explains the four major axes of the method and its secrets. The four axes revolve around the elements Earth, Water, Air, and Fire, and their connection to the universal matter. The text discusses the hidden properties of these elements, their role in the method, and their interaction with each other. Additionally, the author provides an overview of universal matter and its relationship with the elements. Overall, this final section provides insight into the workings of the method and its various components.

Sa représentation traduit la force vitale qui nous anime (10). Cette force s’exprime en nous et en dehors de nous. Elle se comporte comme un fluide invisible de nature étrange. Depuis des millénaires, des érudits ont comprit que la nature toute entière était emplie de forces de vie subtiles et diverses d’origine électromagnétiques. Les forces électromagnétiques agissantes remplissent les différentes fréquences de nos corps subtils. Les anciens connaissaient l’existence de ces corps subtils et des fréquences énergétiques qui les nourrissent. Ils avaient même détaillée leur anatomie subtile avec leurs canaux d’énergie, leurs centrales de condensation et l’aura qu’ils dégagent autour du corps physique.
last_phrase: In conclusion, despite the physical connections between scientific and human magnetism, they are completely different in nature. While scientific magnetism governs the functioning of subatomic particles, the complex and mysterious force of human magnetism represents the vital energy that flows within us and beyond. It has been recognized for millennia, and its understanding has been applied in healing practices such as magnet therapy, demonstrating the potential of electromagnetism in affecting mental and physical processes.
